initial_action: Isolate the host immediately. Alert SOC L2.
investigation_and_remediation: Eviction/Revert: Restore affected registry keys from a known good backup. Analysis: Run a forensic check for related file writes or process injection.

initial_action: Isolate the host immediately. Block the execution command/script hash on all endpoints.
investigation_and_remediation: Eviction/Evict: Kill the malicious interpreter process. Harden: Review and limit non-admin access to command shells (PowerShell, cmd.exe).

initial_action: Immediately disable the compromised user account. Initiate a full credential review.
investigation_and_remediation: Eviction/Evict: Reset the user's password and clear all active sessions (Credential Eviction). Harden: Review the /etc/sudoers file for unauthorized modifications.

initial_action: Block the destination external IP/Domain on the firewall/proxy. Suspend the sending account (if known).
investigation_and_remediation: Analysis: Determine the data source and type of exfiltrated data (Data Loss Prevention review). Harden: Implement or tune a DLP solution to prevent future attempts to the service.

initial_action: Block the source IP address temporarily at the firewall/load balancer.
investigation_and_remediation: Eviction/Evict: Force a password reset for any successful logons immediately following the brute force. Harden: Enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and set a strict account lockout policy.

initial_action: Isolate affected systems and block access to the vulnerable service (apply WAF rule or firewall block). Notify IR and SOC.
investigation_and_remediation: Analysis: Review web server, WAF, proxy and access logs to identify exploit indicators and attacker activity; search for web shells, backdoors, unexpected uploads and lateral movement. Remediation: Apply vendor patches or configuration fixes, remove malicious artifacts, rotate credentials and keys, rebuild compromised hosts from known-good images, and run a full vulnerability scan & public endpoint audit.
